# Legal Approach Document: Automated Developer Radio/TV Station

**Document Version:** 1.0  
**Date:** November 26, 2025  
**Status:** Research Complete - Approach Defined

---

## 1. Executive Summary

This document outlines the legal framework, sources consulted, and chosen approach for operating an automated developer radio/TV station that broadcasts project updates, music, and alerts via YouTube Live streaming.

**Key Decision:** We will operate under a **transparency-first, royalty-free content model** that complies with international AI regulations and platform policies.

---

## 2. Sources Consulted

### 2.1 Platform Policies

| Source | URL | Key Takeaways |
|--------|-----|---------------|
| **YouTube AI Policies** | https://www.youtube.com/howyoutubeworks/ai/ | Must disclose AI-generated content; labels may be applied to sensitive topics |
| **YouTube Live Streaming** | https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9288567 | Account verification required; community guidelines apply |
| **YouTube Conversational AI** | https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/14110396 | Reference for AI feature integration |
| **YouTube Data API v3** | https://developers.google.com/youtube/v3 | Programmatic stream management |

---

## 3. Legal Risk Assessment

### 3.1 Identified Risks

| Risk | Severity | Mitigation |
|------|----------|------------|
| **Copyright infringement (music)** | High | Use only royalty-free/CC-licensed music |
| **AI content non-disclosure** | Medium | Always disclose AI generation in description |
| **Voice simulation without consent** | High | Never simulate identifiable individuals |
| **Platform policy violation** | Medium | Follow YouTube guidelines strictly |
| **License non-compliance** | Medium | Maintain documentation, monthly audits |
| **Privacy violations** | Low | Only broadcast our own project data |

### 3.2 Risk Tolerance

We adopt a **conservative, compliance-first approach** given:
- Public nature of YouTube broadcasts
- Evolving AI regulatory landscape
- Desire for long-term sustainable operation

---

## 4. Chosen Legal Approach

### 4.1 Content Licensing Strategy

**Decision: Royalty-Free + Creative Commons Only**

We will NOT use:
- ‚ùå YouTube Premium music (personal use only)
- ‚ùå Apple Music content (personal use only)
- ‚ùå Tidal content (personal use only)
- ‚ùå Any content without clear licensing

We WILL use:
- ‚úÖ YouTube Audio Library (free, YouTube-safe)
- ‚úÖ StreamBeats (royalty-free, no attribution)
- ‚úÖ Creative Commons music (with proper attribution)
- ‚úÖ Epidemic Sound (if subscribed, universal license)
- ‚úÖ Public domain content

### 4.2 AI Content Disclosure

**Decision: Full Transparency**

All AI-generated content will be disclosed:

1. **Stream Description:** Clear AI disclosure section
2. **On-Screen Labels:** For any AI-generated visuals
3. **Audio Disclosure:** Periodic mention that content is AI-generated
4. **Metadata:** Proper tagging per YouTube requirements

**Template Language:**
```
ü§ñ AI DISCLOSURE: This stream contains AI-generated content including 
text-to-speech narration and automated project summaries. No real 
individuals are simulated. Content is generated from our own project data.
```

### 4.3 Attribution Framework

**Decision: TASL + Documentation**

All attributed content follows Creative Commons TASL standard:
- **T**itle of the work
- **A**uthor/creator name
- **S**ource URL
- **L**icense type and link

Documentation maintained in:
- `MUSIC_CREDITS.md` - All music attributions
- `CONTENT_INVENTORY.md` - All third-party content
- Stream description - Summary attributions

### 4.4 Software Licensing

**Decision: SPDX Compliance**

All software dependencies documented with:
- SPDX license identifiers
- License compatibility verification
- Attribution in NOTICE/LICENSE files

Compatible licenses prioritized:
- MIT, Apache-2.0, BSD-3-Clause (permissive)
- CC0, CC-BY (creative content)

### 4.5 Privacy Approach

**Decision: Own Data Only**

- Only broadcast data from our own projects
- No personal information about individuals
- No simulation of real people's voices/likenesses
- Git commit data anonymized if needed

---

## 5. Compliance Procedures

### 5.1 Pre-Launch Checklist

- [ ] YouTube account verified
- [ ] AI disclosure added to stream description
- [ ] MUSIC_CREDITS.md created with all tracks
- [ ] CONTENT_INVENTORY.md created
- [ ] All music licenses verified
- [ ] TTS provider terms reviewed
- [ ] Stream description template applied

### 5.2 Ongoing Compliance

**Monthly Audit:**
- [ ] Review all music licenses (valid/expired)
- [ ] Check subscription renewals
- [ ] Verify attribution accuracy
- [ ] Update documentation with new content
- [ ] Review AI disclosure for accuracy
- [ ] Check for platform policy updates

**Per-Content Addition:**
- [ ] Verify license permits streaming use
- [ ] Add to MUSIC_CREDITS.md or CONTENT_INVENTORY.md
- [ ] Update stream description if attribution required
- [ ] Document license terms and expiry

### 5.3 Incident Response

If we receive:
- **Copyright claim:** Immediately remove content, review license
- **Policy violation notice:** Review, correct, document
- **Takedown request:** Comply, assess, document for future

---

## 6. Regulatory Alignment

### 6.1 Israel AI Policy 2023 Compliance

| Requirement | Our Approach |
|-------------|--------------|
| Transparency | Full AI disclosure in all broadcasts |
| Privacy | No personal data, own project data only |
| Safety | Review TTS output before broadcast |
| Bias mitigation | Factual project data, no opinions presented as facts |

### 6.2 EU AI Act Readiness

| Requirement | Our Approach |
|-------------|--------------|
| Risk classification | Low-risk (informational content) |
| Transparency | Clear AI labeling |
| Documentation | Full content inventory |

### 6.3 YouTube Policy Compliance

| Requirement | Our Approach |
|-------------|--------------|
| AI disclosure | Description + labels |
| Community guidelines | Content review before broadcast |
| Copyright | Licensed content only |
| Privacy | No identifiable individuals |

---

## 7. Documentation Requirements

### 7.1 Required Files

| File | Purpose | Update Frequency |
|------|---------|-----------------|
| `MUSIC_CREDITS.md` | Music attribution | Per content addition |
| `CONTENT_INVENTORY.md` | All third-party content | Per content addition |
| `LEGAL_APPROACH.md` | This document | Major changes only |
| `LICENSE` | Project license | Initial setup |
| `NOTICE` | Third-party attributions | Per dependency addition |

### 7.2 Stream Description

Must include:
1. AI disclosure section
2. Music credits summary
3. Link to full credits
4. Legal compliance statement

---

## 8. Decision Log

| Date | Decision | Rationale |
|------|----------|-----------|
| 2025-11-26 | Use royalty-free music only | Avoid copyright risk, sustainable model |

| 2025-11-26 | Monthly compliance audits | Proactive risk management |
| 2025-11-26 | Own project data only | Privacy protection, no consent issues |
